title: Drawing, "Design for Textile-Inventory Card", 1952–69
medium: Red, blue and green colored pencil, graphite on white tracing paper fastened to cardboard with five staples
inscribed: Verso in graphite upper left corner: II - 12
provenance: This collection was donated to the Cooper-Hewitt, National Design Museum in 1969 by Alexander Girard
description: Pattern of three rows of five squares, each with a four petaled flower motif in the center, alternating with a diamond. The upper  and lower squares on the right have no quatrafoil pattern in the center

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for Textile-Inventory Card", 1952–69.
1952–69. Red, blue and green colored pencil, graphite on white tracing paper fastened to cardboard with five staples. Gift of Alexander H. Girard. 1969-165-430.
